definition: flower/blossom/CL:朵[duo3],支[zhi1],束[shu4],把[ba3],盆[pen2],簇[cu4]/fancy pattern/florid/to spend (money, time)/(coll.) lecherous/lustful
double-edged sword/CL:口[kou3],把[ba3]/classifier for blows of a sword

sentences.english: The foil is a thrusting weapon with no cutting edge.
sentences.chinese: 花劍，沒有劈殺用的劍刀，是刺戳用兵器。

sentences.english: The study examined influential factors of foil fencers decision-making in simulating fencing situation.
sentences.chinese: 研究了影響花劍運動員決策速度和準確性的因素。

sentences.english: In foil and saber, only the attacking fencer can score a point.
sentences.chinese: 在花劍和佩劍比賽中，只有進攻方纔能得分。

sentences.english: Actually, I am a competitive foil fencer.
sentences.chinese: 實際上我是個花劍比賽選手。

sentences.english: Italy's women's foil team is stacked with the top three fencers in the world.
sentences.chinese: 意大利女子花劍隊有三名世界頂級選手壓陣。

definition: Lee Lai-Shan (1970-), former windsurfing world champion from Hong Kong
to snatch gold/to take first place in a competition
to dress up and make up (like an actor)
to win every trick in a card game/grand slam/fig. total success
lit. to win a victory on raising the flag (idiom); fig. to start on sth and have immediate success/success in a single move
